headline: Cintas terminates discussions on $5.3 billion bid to acquire UniFirst
summary: "While we continue to believe in the merits of a transaction, we were unable to have substantive engagement with UniFirst regarding key transaction terms," Cintas CEO Todd Schneider said.  UniFirst had in early January rebuffed a takeover proposal from Cintas for $275 per share in cash and said it was confident of its strategy as a standalone company.

headline: Cintas Ends Talks to Buy UniFirst After Failing to Reach a Deal

headline: Cintas Terminates Discussions with UniFirst
summary: CINCINNATI, March 24, 2025--Cintas Corporation (Nasdaq: CTAS) (the "Company") today announced that it has terminated discussions with UniFirst Corporation (NYSE: UNF) regarding Cintas’ proposal (the "Proposal") to acquire all of the outstanding common and class B shares of UniFirst for $275.00 per share in cash, a premium of 46% over UniFirst’s ninety-day average closing price as of January 6, 2025, the last trading day before the Proposal was made public.

headline: Cintas Gears Up to Report Q3 Earnings: What's in the Offing?
summary: CTAS' fiscal third-quarter results are likely to gain from the increasing demand for AED Rentals, eyewash stations and WaterBreak products.
